document.title: Kansas Standards for English Language Arts

9A71F31B441741D28DA3D5B1C8EE814A.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, and read alouds.

20B83095DD7F45A7A44EDD81C8F20497.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

10D3FDE9C9F34800B331602234887EC3.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions in written work (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

AD939F32D0A344ACBA065A330B4048A2.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

6D1D23947A4E4449ACFF7BFF53294F11.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

FD76CF20F2CB4A68AE4743C3C5F11C66.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs in speech.

6E94B09B72D4474492D094FE9B4AC210.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standards English grammar and usage when speaking.

746142896E9E41779FBB99862033EB7F.description: Speak with appropriate volume, enunciation, and rate to express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

1E329AB2927D49EEBA387CBFCD1D1941.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to supply additional detail to descriptions.

34538EDA37524EEF98CE3065626EAD1B.description: Use details to describe familiar people, places, things or events with prompting and support.

7AA6EF2C596B4D86AED6394222442E99.description: Ask and answer questions to seek help, get information or clarify what is not understood.

28B526CCFE5E475189E7169AEF9EFC8D.description: Confirm sequence of events of a read aloud or media presentation by asking and answering questions about key details or requesting clarification of what is not understood.

D870C86907474B28B96514A9B9549D09.description: Extend a conversation through multiple exchanges.

B0555E81E1A949B0AA1BDAB102F1813B.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

908302E517AD4574BB3757ED1D45F10A.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups to expand language comprehension.

F54940194A7749F6AC92B41E8329C42F.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of letter-sound relationships.

CEE826098F8C44D6A865E9232F566E9B.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short vowel sounds.

5E2F763894914EC89F9AD1DED68FB80A.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

D82E29BBBFA14A3EA0083C9D633207EC.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation and spelling when writing.

BE61D17A3F26486ABEB79D119286F9C0.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

AB6D491F920047FBA46A785ABCA7A7EC.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions in written work (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

21976A61B4FD4AF588C026CA25D6C6B1.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

1B973AAD9EBB4DEA9C18AE41D47AB77A.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs in writing.

9778E1250A204CA0B1FBA229688F0189.description: Correctly form upper and lowercase letters with line awareness.

5346D645C276450CB663940E25CFDC54.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standards English grammar and usage when writing.

90EAE173AC354AEFACFADE40989DEBD5.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

B80BB95AE65E4E839D4ECE07F680DA9D.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

5EF6E1530936472EAC99982EFEF6AC68.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

EA07C4975CE24796A1EEBA8101C6838D.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

70FF916D259240598B0B8801F7733A0F.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

3CA6CED2EEF04DF2AB73F7F9B5150D13.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred and provide a reaction to what happened.

98996963EB4647CFB78C4AEB67BC63AB.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

49C44BC1F9C54D1BA86A3A2F9E49CC3A.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is ...).

D5ADC388863640F2901A1425695AE091.description: Actively engage in individual or group readings of informational text with purpose and understanding.

970E00B7DC5141C59AB2A6E8ACEABCF5.description: Range of Reading and Text Complexity

FFCB957933ED426C92E5C7EF603460DB.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

AA9B52B601E045E19EB4D46984428C9E.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

B828065EFC224DDC91B72017302766AB.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

816C00D649B6460C965A66A0D497BB96.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

3B5B7812720F464B9EEDF0F72B1C184B.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

29C740DF836F4A6AB584F1EFAF25DC66.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflectional endings and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) to determine the meaning of an unknown word.

3FF8E754C22B4627905847B22456D80B.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb duck).

072D5345CCCA436FA86DAD5CED326FDB.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases in reading and content to expand language comprehension.

2CB57AE14E9B4427B97EA3F4ED8AFF29.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions or procedures).

0FA115591F734E919EBB3A50149BD332.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

BDEF7313D473492B95EF0AE67002E4F1.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

3F1B97B1EB69425AAC9BBEAB6E738AC5.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

009F976D15C64D97894F58D8800BFFF0.description: Identify the front cover, back cover and title page of a book.

7774E50A948F49468D2D28821801E6AA.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

92B2FC7C23264817B3B62D6D84B70FA1.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas or pieces of information in a text.

79C96497D6024ABAA35D2270862772A2.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

FE67A76D4D214C9D8810D9BACDC86AEF.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

87ABA8CEC7D447709D0FDF2C7EC74773.description: Listen to high quality drama, prose, and poetry to expand language comprehension.

66EA776671E6458AB4CE4CFE6C39E33C.description: Range of Reading and Text Complexity

836F31073AF743948512AA16EB532B19.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

967D5075429B48D4B66C39AA34101ED1.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

D5FDE8ECA74A460CACE44C888D75B37C.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

262BBC9EC8824EDEA9405EFA5C889CC8.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

0627302D11AB44E3ACFA35373DEACC7D.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings to expand language comprehension.

2407447A8F3E40578FA1E4A6B97FFF1F.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflectional endings and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

A96EC3F3B9864909A9FE7A87361D2259.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb duck).

3749541F72744EEB80E3F087F68DDC4A.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases to expand language comprehension.

078B1841E3314268BEEBA1013E6AE5B0.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

1A417DE83B7B4941960687FC9DA60546.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

A436B393EA464293B4511C6B28BA5C46.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

5DAECA2C94F84321B36B88F6452F3906.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

9A570243F3B54012B2A57ECF73967519.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

C47C62F7DCB14151932185CB26FB6DFE.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings and major events in a story.

30F25DF8A7C94118B8F0F20115994476.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key events.

71CC376363A640AEBFCCF831FA58DC8B.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

DF81279C7F784B2EAC475D58B2281C7A.description: Read decodable texts that support instruction.

EF9747BF94814C01B6CEE8DD50D3B13E.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ (e.g., bat/cat, bat/bit/, bat/bad).

1863FE13B4A449149BC6F840BEFF604F.description: Read common high-frequency words (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

A40C06A7FBE04B3596F188350877E6DD.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

EAFD356414694875AA3491A404D43A5A.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of phoneme-grapheme correspondences of predictable consonants.

760C248DC917459E9ECB6797D4FB00C7.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

844697D5FD304788B9A6B318334B5C16.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes (word families) of single-syllable spoken words.

BC3EAC44DA80495DA5313F0D45A777B4.description: Count, produce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

2C02299F29294126BC77B3E1830B3C99.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final phonemes (sounds) ) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant or CVC) words. (This does not include CVC ending with /l/, /r/ or /x/.) (Phonemic awareness)

C88D37C8354D4F02A2A5C18B75094427.description: Manipulate (segment, blend or substitute) sounds in the initial, final and medial positions. (Phonemic awareness)

80CC09C6C6C7491D995A7CC71778D933.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

A9B428327B4548E98451DA4880A0415E.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print and can point with one- to-one correspondence.

EE317331F2E041DD85EA4D2B54B8492D.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

69F3679DA77147A68884944498A1CBC4.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom and page by page.

846FC59812234727A817384AC034EC73.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
